_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policy: Long Prairie Packing Company

maintains a comprehensive safety, health, and environmental program at the plant. The program

includes engineering, education, and enforcement provisions for hazard communication, spill

prevention and response, hazardous waste, universal waste and waste oil management, waste water

and storm water management.



2. Emergency Response Program: The Long Prairie Packing Company facility has developed an OSHA

hazardous substance emergency action plan. The plan outlines specific procedures for evacuations,

incident alarms and alerting. Depending upon a given situation, the Fire Department will be called to

provide emergency responders and equipment. The Fire Department will be called for all fire related

emergencies. The facility has communicated the hazard of ammonia with the local fire department

and LEPC. The incident commander has ultimate control of implementation of the emergency

response plan.



3. Stationary Source and Regulated Substance: Long Prairie Packing Company is a harvest and food

processing plant located at 10 Riverside Drive, Long Prairie, MN. The building houses a processing

plant used for harvest, processing, freezing, and packaging. The processed products require

refrigeration for processing and storage. Anhydrous ammonia is the primary refrigerant used. There

are two (2) Machinery Rooms located on the south side of the plant and one located on the north side

of the plant. This is the original ammonia refrigeration system.



4. Worst Case and Alternative Release Scenarios: RMP*Comp was used to calculate the worst case

and alternative release scenarios for the process.



5. Five Year Accident History: There have been no reportable incidents during the past five years.

However, the facility maintains records of all incident investigation reports regardless of ammonia

quantity released into the atmosphere.



6. Planned changes to improve sa

fety: Based on the Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) for ammonia, lists

of action items were developed. The status of these action items will be monitored to ensure that

implementation of the safety improvements is accomplished. Monthly Safety training is conducted for

all team members at this facility, in addition PSM meetings are held to review safety and PSM

program elements. Refer to the Process Safety Management Program for specific information.
